inn1.comm: gentle movement curving away from the bat, and Noor Ali stays at the crease to defend to cover.
straighter this time from Panyangara, and Noor Ali shuffles across to the off side to clip to midwicket. But the ball is stopped with some fancy footwork by Chamu at midwicket.
past the outside edge! After a couple of looseners, Panyangara bent his back on this one, and the batsman is beaten by bounce and away movement.
a little fuller, aimed at the top of off, and he's nudged defensively to point.
nicely bowled again, on a length and swinging away on off stump, and it's  watchfully defended by the batsman
Panyangara is quickly into his groove this morning, and Noor Ali's forward press into a defensive stroke comes out once more.
Shahzad aims a flick-pull at the first ball, which is perhaps just a little short of a good length, but he's beaten on the shot and struck on the thigh
hopping defence from the portly right-hander now, Jongwe hitting a splice-jarring length on off stump

take that! Shahzad eyes a full length delivery on off stump and swings his arms beautifully through the line. He didn't over-hit it, and in fact checked the shot, lifting the ball cleanly over mid-off for a one-bounce four
too straight from Jongwe, and now Shahzad clips off his pads out through the gap at square leg. Raza hunts the ball down near the boundary
a touch short, on a middle-stump line, and Shahzad pulls down to fine leg
his is wide, well down the leg side, and Mutumbami has to dive to his left. He gets a glove to it, but can't stop the ball and they run an extra.
thumped to wide long-on! This was short again, but Shahzad saw it early and swiveled back to pull the ball well in front of square
a diving stop by Raza in the covers saves runs! Panyangara pitched this one up to the bat, looking for swing, and Noor Ali leaned forward into a cover drive
Panyangara pulls his length back a touch, and the batsman stands at the crease to try and work the ball through the off side. Not timed
a touch straighter, and aimed at his front pad. Noor Ali works the ball to mid on, slightly uppishly
another full, straight ball, and this one is punched to mid-on rather more firmly
Panyangara wants to get Noor Ali lbw here. He's targeting his pads, and now the batsman flicks to midwicket, where Wellington Masakadza dives to stop
off the bottom edge! Shahzad raised his bat to leave, but was late on it and the bottom edged bounced in front of the keeper
worked quietly down the ground to long on for a single
watchful, almost exaggerated defence from Shahzad to start
cut hard, but straight to the man at point
driven uppishly, but firmly through extra cover! Jongwe dived in the field, in that position, but the ball was quickly past him
no holding back! Shahzad jumps well down the track and clubs the ball cleanly over wide long-on now. There's a fielder out there, but it was well over his head and into the stands
nd now a flashing play and miss outside off! It was the quicker one from Masakadza
Noor Ali comes forward to drive, but he's put in an awkward position by the outswinger and a leading edge squirts into the covers
on a length, swinging away, and Noor Ali guides the ball defensively to gully
past the outside edge yet again! Panyangara looks really good when he gets this outswinger to go. The batsman was comprehensively beaten
a touch fuller, on off stump, and the ball is driven to extra cover without much timing
nicely full once again, allowing the ball time to swing. But not a half-volley, and the batsman presses forward to defend
and here's the variation from the bowler. This one curves the other way, into the pads. But it's high, and also going down leg, so there's no appeal
hahzad stretches out to defend his first ball down the track. This surely won't last
the man is out on the boundary at long on, so there's a single on offer and Shahzad takes it with a gentle drive
the batsman lunges forward to defend
nice little shot, a straight drive. It's not hit too hard, so the long on fielder can cut it off
eased down to long-on once again
Shahzad flicks across his front pad, but straight to the fielder at square leg
Panyangara continues to hit that testing length outside off with the new ball, and the batsman can only defend to cover point
a little wider, and Noor Ali leans across to drive, but there's no beating Raza at cover. He dives, stops and returns in one fluid motion
this one hits the seam and goes on straight, the batsman working it into the leg side
sliced up and over gully, and down to third man! Panyangara floated one up well outside off, and Noor Ali went after it with a flashing blade
Shahzad defends a length delivery back down the track. Seems an unnatural stroke for him! He looks a little awkward in defence. Unlike when he goes on the attack ...
shuffling, walking defence again from Shahzad as he sees off a swinging delivery on a length
twirled down on off stump, from around the wicket, and it's pushed defensively to cover

dropped! The batsman lunged forward at the ball, feathering an edge, but Mutumbami couldn't hold on as he dived forward. Good effort though. He's completely demolished the stumps trying to catch the ball.
careful defence to cover once again
cracking stroke! A full ball is lifted up and over extra cover, and bounces away to the rope
clipped down to long on for one, plenty of bottom hand in the shot.
whipped off the pads, but straight to Ervine at square leg
full and straight, and the batsman presses his weight forward as he flicks to midwicket
nicely bowled. On a length and swinging away. Noor Ali raises his arms to leave
just outside off, and the batsman opens the face to find a single to third man

spanked over the top! Shahzad didn't move his feet one inch to this length delivery, but flicked his wrists at the ball to pick the ball up and over mid on. There was a hint of 'helicopter-shot' about this
speared down full and straight, and the batsman glances the ball to deep square leg, where there is a man on the boundary
well, the over is eventually completed, after a fashion. Panyangara runs in off a six step run up and delivers a length delivery which the batsman defends. I'm not sure what was happening there ...
looped down on middle and off, from around the wicket. The batsman defends
punched into the leg side, looking for the single to long on, but Raza comes round from midwicket to cut it off
defended back down the track.
pushed defensively to mid off now.
a quicker one spits up at the batsman, who defends one-handed to midwicket
and the bowler completes a maiden as the final ball is tapped softly to midwicket
punched firmly to cover
hacked brutally off the back foot now. Raza gets his hand down to stop it at cover, but it's a stinging blow and he's down for a bit, holding his hand
Shahzad comes forward to drive to long-off
nicely stopped by Chigumbura! Noor Ali's drive was headed for long off, but he rushed across from extra cover to stop it
flicked off the toes into the leg side, in front of square
driven hard back to the bowler, who jumps in his follow through and then walks down the pitch, chest puffed out, to chat to the batsman. Shahzad getting is as much as he gives it out
flicked to Raza at midwicket, no run
Noor Ali skips down the track and drives to long-on
Shahzad presses forward and drives, but straight to cover
a quicker one hurries past the outside edge! A bit of a nothing shot by the batsman
outside off stump, and Shahzad drives to long off
chopped down to gully, where Panyangara dives to stop it
hacked in the air on the off side, but the ball drops well short of Williams at long-off
pushed to extra cover
nice shot, a very late cut down to third man
clipped off the pads, but straight to midwicket
punched back to the bowler
this one slips out as a low full toss, and it's driven to long-on. The fifty stand is up!
twirled down on off stump, the batsman drives to the right of extra cover, who stops it but not cleanly
driven back to the bowler, who bumps into Shahzad as he stops the ball. It's clearly an accident, and both men are all smiles as Williams says sorry and taps him on the back
eased down to long-on, just the one
quiet stuff first up, the ball is flicked to midwicket along the ground

got him! Shahzad wanted to have a go straight away, and sprinted down the track looking to launch this all the way to Bulawayo Airport. But he ran right past the ball as he swung his bat, and it crashed into his middle stump. Williams breaksthrough!
tapped defensively back to the bowler
Noor Ali stands at the crease and turns the ball to leg, against the spin
pushed back to the bowler
Noor Ali stays on the back foot to punch to cover
same ball, same shot, same result. Dot ball
forced through mid on off the back foot, midwicket dives but can't stop it
a quicker ball, aimed right at the batsman's toes, is dug out back down the track
full and straight, he drives back to the bowler who stoops in his follow through to stop it
sliced in the air! The batsman wanted to drive over extra cover, but the ball spun away from him, taking the edge and flying down to third man.
defended to cover
defence into the off side now
sharp work from Williams! Noor Ali came down the track and drove the ball hard back at him. The bowler collected it and immediately threw down the stumps, but the batsman was safe
pushed back to the bowler, again Williams mimics throwing down the stumps
nudged defensively into the leg side
again Chigumbura at midwicket has some work to do, stopping a flick to leg
eased to long-on
shot! Noor Ali, who is batting in just a red cap now, backs away to leg to make room and carves a drives through extra cover
pushed to cover again, this time much more softly
Noor Ali comes forward and drives to long off, just the single
watchful defence, and the ball rolls slowly back to the bowler
he comes down the track now, and flicks the ball to long-on
there's a hint of edginess about this shot. Nabi wanted to go straight, but the ball came straight on with the arm, taking the inside half of the bat and rolling to midwicket
pushed to long-off
Nabi stays deep in the crease and punches to long on, along the ground
eased defensively to extra cover, off the front foot
spin back in from around the wicket, and Nabi is struck on the pad. Heading down leg
Nabi is forward to defend to cover
edged! He came forward to drive but this ball didn't spin, taking the edge and rolling to short third man
flicked to short fine leg
huge appeal for lbw! Raza came around the wicket, and this one pitched outside off, spinning back in. But it struck the batsman high, above the knee roll
solid defence ends the over
a paddle sweep sends the ball rolling down to short fine leg
another sweep from the batsman, and Williams has pushed this too far down the leg side
Noor Ali comes forward to drive to long-on
Nabi stays on the back foot and punches to extra cover
turned off the pads, through square leg
nicely placed, Noor Ali waiting in the crease and flicking into space in front of square on the leg side
turned to leg once again, but this time it's close enough to Raza at midwicket to stop the single
huge sweep from the batsman, who falls over as he plays the shot. But no connection, ball striking him on the pad
firmly driven down the ground. Raza gets a palm to it
flicked with the spin through square leg
punched to Chigumbura at extra cover
whipped through midwicket, where it splits the field and they rush back for the second
Noor Ali jumps down the track, but Raza spots him and pulls his length back. The ball pops off the glove into the off side
punched down to long on, off the back foot
Noor Ali also stays on the back foot, forcing the ball to extra cover
a top-edged paddle sweep balloons up and over the keeper, bouncing down to fine leg
pushed down to long-on, one more
looped down quite slowly through the air. Nabi waits for it and threads the gap at square leg
another drive sends the ball to long on. Raza sprints across from midwicket and dives, but he can't stop it
Raza sees the batsman's intentions, coming down the wicket, and drags the ball down short to stop the shot
turned with the spin in to the leg side, in front of square
Noor Ali's bottom hand comes off the bat as he flicks this awkwardly to leg, the ball popping in the air but landing safe
pushed down to long-off, off the back foot
superb, diving stop by Mutombodzi, sprinting across from midwicket, thwarts the single
another dive in the field,this time by Williams at cover, to stop a back-foot punch. Good commitment
punched to extra cover, off the back foot
nicely chipped, wide of long-on. Nabi was aiming for placement, rather than power, and the long on fielder rushes around to cut it off
up and over extra cover! Nabi is taking the initiative now. He steps back and lofts cleanly over extra cover
driven to extra cover again, but along the ground and straight to the fielder inside the ring
punched back to the bowler, who fields the ball and sends the batsman scampering back into the crease by threatening to throw the stumps down
a drive into the off side threads the gap at cover, and the sweeper cleans up
flicked off the pads, with the spin, straight to short fine
big appeal for lbw! The batsman wanted to sweep, but missed the ball and was struck on the pad
flicked hard, but straight to midwicket
hacked into the covers, where Williams stops it
glanced out through the gap at square leg
and again the gap at square leg is found for another single
looped down very full and quite wide, and the batsman reaches out to drive to the cover sweeper
driven hard, and Chigumbura at extra cover dives to cut it off
beaten on the drive outside off! Definite spin for Tino. Mutumbami can't quite collect it cleanly, but the ball goes nowhere so there's no bye
lovely ball, dipping on middle and leg and drawing the batsman forward in defence
Noor Ali comes down the track to catch this on the full, and flicks to midwicket
pushed back down the track to the bowler
pushed through flat and fast outside off, and the batsman is beaten on the cut. Past the bottom edge
slower through the air, and it's flicked to midwicket
the bottom hand comes into the shot as Noor Ali drives to long off
another quicker ball, and it's tapped back to the bowler
driven softly to extra cover, straight to Chigumbura
pushed to long-off now, just the single
fetched from outside off with an aggressive sweep, the ball going to midwicket
a shimmy, a clean swing, and six runs! Great shot. He came down the track and got right to the pitch of the ball, biffing it well over long-on
and he brings up his second consecutive half century with a firm push through extra cover, off the back foot. Well played
Nabi takes his bottom hand off the bat as he forces to extra cover off the back foot. It looks like he was surprised by a little extra bounce
pushed against the spin, to Raza at straight midwicket
cut away, but straight to the point fielder
swept hard out to long leg, where there's a man positioned to stop the shot
hat's almost cleaned up the umpire! Nigel Llong had to take evasive action to get out of the way of this booming straight drive
punched to extra cover, off the back foot
nicely swept down to fine leg, beating a diving Ervine at short fine
the batsman drives hard back down the ground. Raza got his hands down at the ball, but not quite in time to stop it and the ball shoots right between his legs
pushed defensively to cover, off the back foot
flighted up nice and high. The batsman waits on it and pushes to cover
driven hard, but the bottom hand takes over the stroke and the ball rolls to midwicket
Noor Ali stays deep in the crease and forces through extra cover.
flicked down to fine leg. It goes very fine and the fielder has some work to do
a quicker one surprises the batsman, and he fends down to gully
a cheeky little paddle sweep gets the ball down to fine leg once again, and they're back for the second
looped down on off stump, from around the wicket, and the batsman drives to cover
quicker ball, much quicker! The batsman punches to point
this one he holds back a little, and the ball grips and spins from leg to off

bowled him! Noor Ali wanted to sweep this, but he didn't read the pace well and the ball shot past him before he was in position, knocking back his leg stump. Chisoro loves it! He turns and stands, arms outstretched and legs spread wide, in an Afridi-style celebration. That's the breakthrough Zimbabwe needed
very full and straight to the new batsman, who clips to the square leg fielder

he's gone second ball! This was a quicker ball, and it was slightly short. Mangal leaned back to pull, and struck the ball very cleanly. Unfortunately, Luke Jongwe was prowling on the deep midwicket boundary, and he sprinted around to hold an athletic catch, diving forward. That's a really good effort from the fielder. He timed his dive just right, plucking the ball out of the air just in time, and holding on as his elbows hit the turf. Double strike!
his first ball back is full and straight, and quite quick for a loosener. The batsman digs it out to mid-on
play and a miss! Stanikzai wanted to blast this up and over point, but the ball rushed quickly past him

Afghanistan are crumbling! Stanikzai has barely allowed himself a sighter at Jongwe, and again he's set himself at the crease and had a huge go at the ball. This time he wanted to attack the leg side, the delivery being just short of a length, but he was beaten by the inward movement, the ball taking the bottom edge and Mutumbami holding a fine catch tumbling forward as the ball died in front of him
full, just outside off, and the ball squirts to gully off the outer half of the bat
Jongwe grunts as he releases this effort ball, which leaps up off a length and is defended to cover off the splice
full and straight, Shenwari meets it with an equally straight bat to defend
Nabi leans forward and turns his wrists over the ball to get it to midwicket
eased down to long-on for a single
a quicker one from Chisoro, but the batsman reads it well and clips through square leg
driven to long-on
Shenwari taps to cover and wanders out, looking for a single. Nabi sends him back with a loud "no!"
off the edge! And there's no slip. Chisoro leapt in the air in excitement as the edge flew past Mutumbami and down to third man
another outside edge, but this one is controlled and somewhat deliberate, down to third man
"catch it" shouts Jongwe as this full ball zips past Nabi's outside edge. Nothing on it
good comeback from the batsman, who steps forward and slashes a full ball behind point. Some committed fielding stops the boundary, and the schoolchildren in the Western stands cheer their approval
tapped down to gully, where Ervine is quite close in and dives forward to stop it
on a length and seaming in off the track, the batsman defending to mid off
flicked just wide of Chamu at mid on, and they sprint through for a single
Chisoro lands this one well wide of off, and Shewari sends it bouncing down to long off
Nabi follows suit, though his technique in getting the ball to long off is rather more refined
definite spin for Chisoro. He held this one back a bit, and it gripped the surface to spin from leg to off, the batsman defending
punched to cover
driven hard back to the bowler, who picks it up and flings the ball straight back. Shenwari has to duck to get out of the way of it
driven with lovely flourish out to the cover sweeper
sharp single! Shenwari defended it down right by his own feet, but Nabi wanted the single and called straight away
past the outside edge! Nabi wanted to run this down to third man, but the ball bounced past him
this time Nabi gets up on his toes, making sure to play down at the ball and does get it down to third man
off the splice! But short of gully. Shenwari wanted the easy single to third man, but the ball leapt up at him. Seems there might be some extra bounce from this end

that's the wicket Zimbabwe wanted! And Nabi didn't really look like getting out any other way. Shenwari played the ball to gully once again, who stopped it on the bounce. It's Mutombodzi in that position. He didn't quite stop it cleanly, and Nabi wanted a single off the misfield. Shenwari didn't, and he was probably right, as Tino recovered very quickly and threw the ball to Panyangara with both batsmen staring at each other at the same end.
punched out through extra cover, off the back foot
flicked back to the bowler
driven softly to extra cover, where Chigumbura stops it
pushed down to long-off for the single
tip and run single! The ball went into the leg side, but not far. But the call was immediate, and it's a safe run
punched back to the bowler
a little wide, and it's hacked out to the cover sweeper with plenty of bottom hand
nicely played, a late cut very fine to third man.
past the batsman, past the keeper! This ball went straight on with the arm, from around the wicket, and beat everybody. It went right through Mutumbami's legs. And Ervine comes in to slip now.
tapped down defensively to point
again the ball is worked to point, straight to the fielder

gosh that's a brave single. This time the ball was worked just in front of square into a packed off side field, but the single was called for and the batsman was safe as the throw came in and Mutumbami whipped the bails off. A direct hit would have had him
flicked through the gap at square leg
he comes round the wicket, and this pitches and spins - but down the leg side
the batsman wanted a late cut, but the ball spun in to him, cramping the shot
turned with the spin into the leg side, piercing the field
a touch of extra bounce outside off, and the batsman stands up tall to punch to cover
acrobatic stop by the bowler! It was driven hard to his right, so he had some work to do
pushed back to the bowler, and stopped much more tamely
this one goes a little squarer into the leg side, but midwicket is in place to stop it
bowled him! Masakadza strikes straight away! Shenwari set himself for a mighty sweep to leg, but the ball rushed straight on with the arm, nipping under the bat and shattering the timber
watchful defence from the teenager, leaning well forward
and again he's forward to defend
Rashid stretches way down the wicket to defend again
just the two gears for the young bat. After his careful defence he backs away, exposing his stumps, and cuts underneath the ball, beaten. Fortunately for him, it bounced over the stumps
full and wide, and the drive is intercepted at cover
looped down with generous flight, the ball zipping past the sweep and rolling to fine leg off the pad. A leg bye taken
this time he does nail the sweep, getting the ball well up and over Ervine at short fine leg
driven back to the bowler, who collects and hurls it back to break the striker's stumps. Zimbabwe have been noticeably more aggressive in the field today
swept hard, and square, out to the sweeper
chipped up and over a leaping Tino at straight midwicket, the ball plugging in the outfield in front of long on.
pushed gently to cover
past the outside edge! The batsman beaten on the cut.
nudged into the leg side, where Raza cuts it off at midwicket
slashed down to third man! The batsman leaned back to cut this quicker one, the ball flying off the top edge
punched through extra cover, off the back foot
pushed back to the bowler
solid defence to end the over
driven to extra cover, off the front foot
big drive! But it meets nothing but fresh air. Play and a miss
cautious defence, the ball trickling back to the bowler
quicker ball, right up to the bat, and it's dug out back to the bowler
lunging forward defence, and a dead bat. No run
just a little short, outside off, and the batsman finds a single out to the cover sweeper
the batsman charges out at a flighted delivery, and the ball skews high in the air off the outside half of the bat, but falls safely in the outfield in front of the cover sweeper
driven down to long off
muscled to wide long-on, off the back foot. Chamu is quick enough to get around from long on and cut off the boundary
on the up drive, straight to long off
nudged down to backward point, no run
a paddle sweep goes very fine, just past the keeper, and they rush back for the second
driven firmly back to the bowler
beaten by turn and bounce! The ball dipped, gripped and spun hard past the batsman's sweep, outside off.
beaten again! This time on the cut. Definite spin for Chisoro

dropped at extra cover! Well, it was a really tough chance. The ball was chipped in the air, and Raza had lots of ground to make. He timed his jump, but it was always a struggle to get to the ball. He got one hand to it, but couldn't hold on
pushed to cover along the ground
solid defence ends the over

missed stumping now! The batsman ran right past this quicker one, aiming for the big straight hit, but the ball really leapt up off the surface to beat him. Mutumbami is struck a stinging blow on the body, he couldn't get his gloves up in time
turned off the hip, behind square on the leg side
a glide sends the ball to Chigumbura at backward point, and the batsman wanders out looking for a single, before being urgently sent back
defended back down the track
eased through mid off for a single
driven a little harder, down to long off

fine catch by Mutumbami! He's not had an easy job behind the stumps today, but this is an excellent reflex catch. Rashid bent low to slog sweep, but turn and bounce meant the ball took a thin top edge. Mutumbami whipped his gloves up and held it cleanly, Nigel Llong upholding the appeal for caught behind.
almost yorked him first ball! This was quicker, right up to the bat, and the batsman just managed to get the bottom edge of the bat onto it
the batsman pokes forward in defence, and is beaten as the ball spins past him
the ball takes the top edge of a lapped sweep, but falls safely at short fine
tip and run single into the covers, where Chisoro swoops to hurry the batsman
hoicked gracelessly out to deep midwicket, along the ground though the batsman was looking for the aerial shot
flat-batted down the ground, but not that well timed so long off is able to get around the boundary and cut it off
that's come out of the middle! Shafiqullah got right underneath this and blasted it way, way over long on. Big hit.
pushed just wide of extra cover, and they take the single.
boom! A full, wide delivery is crashed through cover for four. The tailender holding nothing back in the shot
hacked out to deep cover once again, in the air but falling safely. Dawlat is trying to hit the cover off everything
down the ground! The ball was full and straight. Shafiq cleared the front leg and crunched it straight back past the bowler. Some late hitting is lifting Afghanistan
the batsman creates a single off the bottom edge, via the pad, to gully. He was aiming for Row 'M' in the stands
driven down to long off, where some energetic work from Raza saves the boundary
flapped up and over the keeper! It was a quicker ball, on a length and straight, and Dawlat shuffled right across to the off side to ramp it over the keeper's head
muscled flat and hard to wide long on! When he does connect, the ball really travels. This is great hitting
smashed down the ground, but straight to long on
Shafiqullah misses with the slog sweep, but they sneak a leg bye as the ball rolls into the off side. Chisoro thought he has his man lbw, but the umpire didn't agree
hammered straight back over the bowler's head! It was there to hit, on a length straight, and he connected mightily. This is a superb cameo innings

it's all happening! The batsman flashed the ball out in the air towards the cover sweeper. The fielder couldn't get to it in time, but the batsmen were in disagreement over how many runs to take, and were both down at one end. But the throw came to the wrong end - the keeper's - and Richmond fired a throw at the non-striker's end which missed the stumps. Nor could Panyangara hold it cleanly

safe hands! Chamu is usually very good on the high ball and in the outfield. Shafiqullah wanted to blast another six, but he got much more height than distance in the shot. Chamu had to run in as the ball swirled around in a strong breeze, but he set himself right underneath it and held on.
well bowled! Dawlat backed way away to leg and Panyangara fired a pinpoint yorker outside off
another yorker, and this one shoots past the driving bat
well, he's attempted a reverse sweep to the final delivery. It's not come off, but they pinch a single all the same as the ball rolls to cover

inn2.comm: good start, just outside off and Mutumbami defends
past the inside edge! This went on with the arm and very close indeed to the off stump, having beaten the bat.
defended to cover, the batsman stretching well forward
tapped softly back to the bowler
Richmond is on the back foot to push this back to the bowler again.
onfidently off the mark! The bowler looped one down wide of off, and quite slow. Mutumbami stepped forward and met it with a might blow over extra cover. Just short of the boundary.
his has jagged sharply off the seam! It hit the deck and went like a legbreak away from the batsman. But it was outside off and safely left alone
did this keep a little low now? Chamu's body language as he jams the bar down suggests so. But safely kept out
punched firmly to extra cover, off the back foot. Regular bounce on the delivery
rising off a good length, and Chamu stands at the crease to defend.
good, probing length just outside off. Chamu has a good look and leaves it alone
a little too straight from Dawlat, and Chamu flicks him down to fine leg for a couple
angled down to third man, and the batsmen trot through for the single

missed stumping! Chamu jumped down the track, but the ball zipped past him. He was out by a good metre or two, but Shahzad fumbled the take, and by the time he had the bails off Chamu was back in the crease. Hamza is fuming!
Chamu backs away to leg and punches the ball very firmly at the extra cover fielder.
fuller, straighter, and it's pushed past the bowler.
dip, grip and spin for the left armer, but Chamu is back and across to keep it out.
poor delivery, and Mutumbami punishes the bowler for it. The ball was speared down the leg side, and he just had to get bat on it to collect a boundary to fine leg
again Dawlat hits the seam, and the ball shoots away from the bat. Chopped down to cover point
the backfoot punch is a favoured stroke for Chibhabha, and this is a good example of the shot. But it goes straight to extra cover.
on a length and straight, the batsman presents the full face of the bat in defence.
pushed to extra cover off the back foot once more.
double bluff from the bowler? He flings one down at the pads, rather than outside off, but it's dealt with well and the batsman collects runs through the vacant square leg area
nice and straight, on a length, and it's driven back to the bowler, who palms it to mid off in his follow through
Stanikzai swaps spin for pace, and it's Aftab Alam on from the Airport End. Noor Ali is the lone slip fielder
flung down full and wide outside off. Richmond's eyes light up, but he throws his arms too early into the drive and the ball squirts to mid on.
now the batsman walks out at the bowler, targeting the leg side. But he's beaten, perhaps by the pace, and struck on the thigh.
rising from a length, on off stump. Richmond defends from the crease, and continues to stand there nonchalantly when Aftab threatens to throw the stumps down
picked up over midwicket! The ball wasn't all that short, but the batsman read the length early and flicked it up and over the fielder with power and timing.
whipped into the leg side again, but along the ground this time, and straight to the midwicket fielder.

lovely timing. I think Dawlat was aiming for a yorker, but the ball has arrived as a leg stump half volley, and it's flicked to wide long on, all along the carpet. Escorted most of the way there by a fielder.
this is closer to the yorker! The ball is very full once more, and the batsman is struck low on the pad. But it looked to be heading down the leg side, and the umpire turns the appeal down.
slipping towards leg stump once more, but it's on a length and the batsman nurdles two runs through the wide gap square of the wicket.
that's a much better line from the bowler, just outside off, and the ball is defended to cover.
full, and it's punched back to the bowler, who hurls the ball back at the batsman, shattering the stumps. I'm not sure what the point of that was, he hadn't gone anywhere.
nicely played, a neat little punch off the back foot, but it finds Shenwari in the covers so there's no run
pitched up just outside off, and Richmond's drive goes just wide enough of cover to allow a single
bolshy stuff from Afghanistan's quicks, this. Chamu taps it back to the bowler, who picks it up and threatens a throw at the stumps
pushed firmly to cover point, the batsman half forward
Aftab digs one in outside off, and Chamu bottom edges his cut down to third man
nudged down defensively towards cover point.
Mutumbami had a look of Shane Watson about him as he cut this late down to third man for one in a similar fashion to the Australian. He's on the front foot, and plays it late
the batsman charges down the track, looking to blast this over the infield, but the ball skews off the outside edge and bounces down to third man
well bowled. Dawlat hits a top-of-off-stump length and the batsman must defend
flicked aggressively off the hip, a sort of flick-pull, but it goes straight down to the man at fine leg
this spits off a length outside off, but Chamu has read the line and raises his arms to leave
the ball thuds into Chamu's thigh, via the outside edge. He picks it up and throws it back to the bowler
sharp single! The ball was nudged to Stanikzai's right at mid off, but the call came early and the shy went wide.
Chamu has yet more practice of the backfoot punch, but he's not able to thread the ball through the field. Afghanistan's quicks have been quite consistent with their length
flicked off the pads, and down to fine leg. It's just wide of the fielder, so they take the second.
chopped down through gully, a quick single taken.
good shot for no runs. Mutumbami cracks a drive to mid off with a high left elbow.
whipped off the hip for a single to fine leg
again the batsman is able to work the ball into the gap at square leg. No fielder there
punched back down the ground off the back foot. The bowler rushes across but can't stop it
edged! Mutumbami wanted to go over cover, but the drive was edged down to third man instead. No slip in place
this comes on with the arm, from around the wicket, and is tapped back to the bowler.
full outside off, and drilled to mid off.
eased down to long on for a single.

what a way to get a wicket! Chamu backed away and chopped down on the ball, which bounced and was headed back towards the stumps. He stuck his hand out to catch it, reflexively, and tossed it away. Shahzad was alert to the error, appealing straight away, and Nigel Llong gives Chamu out for handling the ball. Chamu is the first Zim batsman to be given out handling the ball
there's a resounding sound off the bat as Mutumbami pulls this short ball away, and he connects well but finds the fielder out in the deep
Ervine steps half forward to this length delivery, pushing to point
punched firmly to mid off, off the front foot.
Aftab charges in from around the wicket, and hits a good length just outside off to draw Ervine's defence.
a touch fuller, and the bat turns in Ervine's hand to turn a straight drive into an on drive. Oohs and aahs from around the field.
nudged defensively into the leg side once more. Ervine doesn't look entirely comfortable with the line that Aftab is bowling from round the wicket.
big appeal straight away! This looked very close. Mutumbami missed his sweep and was struck on the front pad. Perhaps he was hit outside the line of off stump. Not given
defended from the crease, Nabi easing the pace a little.
Mutumbami uses his feet to get out to the ball, working it down to long on.
Nabi comes round the wicket to Ervine, who drives to extra cover.
a touch straighter from the bowler, and Ervine nudges into the leg side.
full and straight, and the ball is pushed softly back to the bowler.
nice looking shot, a straight drive, but the bowler gets a hand down to it to take the sting out of the shot, so it's just one.
no stopping that one! Ervine walks into a cracking square drive, powering the ball right between point and cover point for four.
good follow up, the batsman leaning forward and angling his bat to find a single to third man.
on a length, and nicely straight. Pushed back to the bowler.
Mutumbami sends the ball speeding out to wide long on with a flick of the wrists, and they're back for the second as the fielder runs around.
dodgy single! Mutumbami found the short third man fielder with his angled bat, and Ervine called him through for a single. A direct hit would have seen Ervine well short ...
Mutumbami whips his bat across his front pad, threading the ball through square leg for one.
nudged to midwicket, Nabi coming round the wicket.
under the bat! Ervine leaned back to cut, but the ball zipped under the bat.
pushed through flat and fast, and Ervine is struck on the pad. Clearly slipping down leg.
thumped back to the bowler, who kneels down to stop it.
and another drive back to the bowler ends the over.
but he won't trouble anyone with a ball like that! A long hop sits up outside off, and Mutumbami hammers a pull out to deep midwicket.
cracked out through the covers now, two more to the total
turn and bounce outside off! Mutumbami stepped forward, and then held his bat inside the line to let the ball pass him.
punched to cover off the back foot.
a legitimate play and miss this time! The ball fizzed past his defensive poke

chipped in the air, but short of long on! The ball was slightly short again, but it wasn't really there for the pull. Mutumbami is fortunate he doesn't time this too well, and it drops well short of the fielder.
turned with the spin into the leg side. Short fine leg comes in quickly to field the ball.
dropped at straight midwicket! Mutumbami flicked the ball in the air, and Shenwari got forward to it in time, but the ball popped out as he tumbled to the ground.
and now an appeal for lbw! Mutumbami missed his sweep, but he looked to have been hit well outside off.
turned defensively into the leg side.
Mutumbami comes down the track to turn the ball into a half volley, and picks up two runs to deep midwicket.
glanced to the right of the short fine leg fielder, and they sprint through for one.
heaved down to long on, Mutumbami hitting across the line but along the ground
punched firmly back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through.
off the inside edge! But past the stumps. This spun in sharply, even as Ervine pressed forward, but the inside edge missed the timber
pushed defensively into the covers.
big appeal for lbw! The bowler and keeper were certainly convinced, but Umpire Matibiri is unmoved
clipped with the spin through square leg for one.
Ervine presents the full face of the bat to collect a single to long off.
Ervine presents the full face of the bat to collect a single to long off.
good use of the feet, Mutumbami getting right to it and flicking a single to long on.
not much flight on this one from Nabi, and Ervine leans forward to defend.

just short of long on! Ervine came down the track and lifted the ball towards Noor Ali at long-on, but the fielder only began to move forward very late. The ball bounced just in front of him as he tumbled forward hitting him on the knee. If he'd moved earlier, he'd have caught that easily, and Nabi gives him a good long stare
turned into the leg side for one.
Mutumbami waits in the crease, reading the ball off the pitch, and nudges to point.
big slog sweep, but the ball goes right past the bat, and Rashid is on his haunches. That was close to being bowled
another yelp from the bowler as Mutumbami chops this off the top of off stump.
he's forward this time to defend to cover.
edged past slip! This is a great over from the young spinner. He pitched this right up outside off, and Mutumbami took the bait, trying to drive. A thick edge flew past a diving Nabi at slip.
a little too full to finish, and Mutumbami drives out to the cover sweeper.
defended back down the track.
Mutumbami skips out of his crease, but Nabi sees him coming and pulls his length back
nudged defensively to leg.
again Mutumbami is down the track, but this time he finds the length to his liking and collects a run through square leg.
delivered too straight by the bowler, from around the wicket, and he's eased through the gap on the leg side.
Mutumbami is eager to use his feet again, but his shot pings midwicket.
a roared lbw shout! Ervine tried to reverse sweep, and he got way down the track before he was struck on the pad. It would be very hard for the umpire to give that.
flicked with the spin into the leg side.
Ervine plays nice and straight, presenting the full bat face, to find a single to long off.
a full delivery is placed just wide of the point fielder for a single.
glanced off the pad, straight to short fine.
crouching, careful defence from Ervine.
Hamza lands one on a length outside off, and Mutumbami presses forward in defence
he batsman skips right down the wicket and eases a single to long on.
swept hard out to deep midwicket.
optimistic appeal, to say the least. Mutumbami charged out again and then thrust his bat out in defence. A bit of bat, a bit of pad involved, but there's also an appeal for lbw
flicked to long on for one.
bowled him! Ervine comes half forward, and the ball spins in sharply through bat and pad to castle him. Afghanistan break through, somewhat against the run of play.
Mutumbami's defence is somewhat hurried as Rashid zips through a quicker one.
fifty for Mutumbami! He comes forward and angles the ball to short third man for one.
after a quick chat to Shahzad, Williams leans forward to defend his first ball.
pushed back to the bowler. No alarms.
Williams is off the mark with a backfoot punch through the covers.
big spin for the young leggie, but it's down the leg side. Called wide.
Williams comes forward and drives to cover
up, up and away! Mutumbami nails a short ball over wide long on.
pushed to midwicket.
driven back to the bowler.
Mutumbami finds the gap at square leg for a single.
Williams is well forward to smother the spin in defence.
nicely played, a paddle sweep sends the ball to short fine leg.
the left hander stretches far forward and glances with the spin to short fine leg.
Mutumbami skips down the track, but the leggie sees him coming and pushes the ball well wide. Mutumbami has to reach out for it to avoid being stumped.

the schoolchildren are scattering in the stands! Mutumbami stepped back to this long hop and absolutely hammered it over wide long on. There are lots of kids out there, and they ran in all directions as the ball came down!
miscued off the inside half of the bat, but into space next to mid on for a single.
yes, no, yes from the batsmen! Williams had nudged the ball to cover point, and the shy at the wicket at his end went wide to allow an overthrow.
pulled out to deep square, on the bounce.
nicely played. Mutumbami comes down the track and chips the ball straight back over the bowler's head. Not much power, but well placed.
driven softly to cover.
again the batsman comes down, and this time drives along the ground to long on
Williams uses his feet but can't quite get to the pitch.
a touch too short, and he's cut out to the cover sweeper.
Mutumbami misses this sweep, but the ball takes the pad and rolls to leg. The bowler has his hands on his head, but that was almost certainly missing leg.
just a little short, and on a leg stump line. Williams pulls into the deep
cracked hard to extra cover.
dropped at long off! Mutumbami swung wildly at the ball, slicing underneath it, but the fielder running in from long off couldn't hold on. That's a bad drop. He was right under it, but it popped out.
pushed down the ground.
Mutumbami leans forward to defend.
driven to cover to end the over
a big wide, well down the leg side, and Shahzad can't stop it.
not all that short, but Mutumbami pulls in the air out into the deep. It bounces short of the man at deep midwicket.
a low full toss is tapped down to long on.
some spin for Shenwari, but it's slow spin and Mutumbami waits on it before punching out to deep cover.
there's a hint of leading edge about this, but the ball goes safely to ground.
flicked off the pads, through square leg.
beaten outside off! Mutumbami was waiting on the ball again, looking for a late cut, but the ball zipped past him.
a quicker one, speared down at the toes, is flicked to midwicket.

caught this time! And this was a really good effort, on the run. Mutumbami kneeled down to slog sweep, and though he got a good connection he didn't get it wide enough of a sprinting fielder at deep midwicket. It's Rashid.
whipped across to midwicket, who dives and palms the ball back to the bowler.
flashed square of the wicket, off the back foot, and point dives to stop it but can't stop the single.
turned against the spin, to midwicket.
Chigumbura is off the mark with a good looking drive, the batsman coming well forward to thread the gap at extra cover.
nicely flighted by Shenwari, and the ball dips on Chigumbura, who leans forward to defend.
hard running! Chigumbura pulls out into the deep, just wide of the midwicket sweeper. Somehow, they've pushed for a third. Good running.
driven hard, but straight to mid off.
this is a massive wide. It's barely landed on the pitch. Must have slipped out ...
Williams whips across his front pad to collect a single to long on.
defended back to the bowler.
some bounce off the track! Chigumbura leaned forward to defend, but the ball popped up at him, taking the inside edge and looping up into the leg side.
Williams uses his bottom hand to muscle the ball back past the bowler, and down to a straight long on.
watchful defence from Chigumbura.
the batsman wanted to use his feet here, but he was kept at home by a quicker ball.
this one seemed to come on with the arm, from around the wicket, and Chigumbura turned it wide of midwicket.
a late cut beats point, and they sprint through for another three.
speared down flat and fast, dug out back to the bowler.
he hits a length first up, and Williams props half forward to defend to cover.
just a little short, on a middle stump line, but Williams' pull is mistimed and easily stopped by midwicket.
flicked off the hip, and through the gap at square leg.
good, testing delivery. Aftab hits a length on off stump, and Chigumbura has to be firm in his defence.
a little too straight from the bowler, and he's glanced to fine leg.
Williams calls "yes!" as soon as he plays this drive, towards mid off. A well judged single.
big appeal from keeper and Rashid! I think it's for lbw. Yes, lbw is the shout, and it looked like Williams was hit on the pad as he leaned back to cut. Possibly some bat involved
crunched to cover off the back foot.
full and straight, Williams comes forward and drives back to the bowler.
Williams stays deep in the crease to work a legspinner down to long on.
forced into the covers, off the back foot.
Chigumbura stretches well forward to get to the pitch and drives to long off.
down the track, and spanked back past the bowler! Mid on rushes across, but dives over the ball and it rushes away for four. That's more like the Elton of old.
slower ball? I think so. But it's read early and pushed to point.
there's an appeal for a catch down the leg side ... But the ball was a yorker, and though he did hit it, I think it was hit straight into the ground. Nigel Llong agrees.
punched to point off the back foot.
just a little too straight from Aftab, and Chigumbura is able to turn him through square leg.
Aftab switches to around the wicket for Williams, but the left hander works with the angle to add one more to the total with a glance through the leg side.
not much loop from Rashid, but some fizz off the surface and Williams is hurried in defence.
this one is held back a touch, and grips even more. But as it's slower, Williams defends easily.
a full, leg-stump delivery is flicked neatly through square leg.
punched to extra cover off the back foot.
a slider? Perhaps. It seemed to rush on with the arm, but Chigumbura was right behind it to defend.
floated up very full and quite wide, and Chigumbura drives out to the cover sweeper.
Chigumbura is down the wicket to the quick, and he places his drive wide of the cover fielder. It's hauled in before the ropes, and they're back for two.
dug out back past the bowler, and a single is hustled.
good delivery, wobbling around on that in between length. Williams stays at the crease and defends with a straight bat.
nurdled off the pad for a single in front of square on the leg side.
driven back down the ground, but mid on is around in time to stop it.
the ball tails in just a little, and Chigumbura presses forward to defend.
trademark Williams! He's into position for the reverse sweep in a flash, and nails the shot in front of square.
Hamza spears this one down flat on leg stump, and he's glanced to short fine leg.
Chigumbura comes forward to drive, and places the shot straight enough that there's time for a brace.
punched out through the cover field, off the back foot.
off the pads, an easy single through square leg.
Chigumbura is down the track, and gets to the pitch, but his drive is stopped by the cover fielder's long barrier.
full outside off, and the ball is flashed out square of the wicket.
again Chigumbura dances down the track, but the length is short and he can only tap to cover. He asks about a single, and Williams declines.
a bottom edged cut bounces through to Shahzad behind the stumps.
a checked drive bursts through the hands of Shenwari at cover, and they nip through for a single. Chigumbura is starting to time the ball a little better.

well, Williams is absolutely livid with himself for not putting this away. It wasn't that bad a ball, a little wide outside off, and he taps it to point. But then he swings his bat down, furious at himself. Calm down fella, it's just a dot ball.
past the outside edge! Perhaps Williams' concentration was disturbed. This was also a really good ball, snaking away from the bat off a good length.
nudged down to gully.
softly placed wide of the man at cover, to his left, and they sprint through for one.
chipped down the ground, but it's come right off the toe end of the bat and not really gone anywhere. It falls well short of the long on fielder, and Chigumbura comes down to have a word with him.
punched through cover point, off the front foot.
watchful, almost overly cautious defence from Williams now.
flicked away square of the wicket on the leg side. It's in the air, but there's no fielder nearby.
Williams comes down the track and powers the ball past Nabi's outstretched hand. One really gets the feeling he wants to get a move on now.
cut hard, but straight to the point fielder.
eased down to long off for one.
this one scoots through low outside off, beating Williams' cut.
nudged to midwicket
Williams comes down and gets his drive out to collect another single to long on.
an angled bat sends the ball rolling to extra cover.
a little short outside off from Rashid, and Williams cuts him away for two.
swept hard now, in the air but not for long. Midwicket and deep square converge, and keep them to two.
another sweep, of the paddle variety, goes to short fine leg
Williams flings everything into a heave to leg, but the ball stays along the ground and deep midwicket sprints in to stop the shot.
timing and placement! Chigumbura gets down low to sweep, beating the man just behind square on the leg side for a convincing boundary.
Williams sweeps past a very full ball outside off, and there's half an appeal for a stumping. But his foot stayed at home.
driven down the ground, to long off.
Chigumbura plays with the spin to long on.
the left hander backs away and hacks a cut out into the deep.
nicely driven. Chigumbura keeps his elbow high as he drives to long off.
Williams telegraphs his intentions to reverse sweep, and the length isn't given for the shot. He's hit on the body and the ball drops at his feet.
Chigumbura comes down the track, but gets a little too close to the ball and toe ends his drive to extra cover.
punched down to long on, the batsman hanging on the back foot,

caught at long on! One felt that something like this was coming. He wanted to hurry Zimbabwe's win, but he's chipped the ball cleanly down long on's throat. It's probably too little too late for Afghanistan.
the batsman comes well forward to defend.
squirted just wide of cover, and they rush through.
tapped down just in front of square, a quick single.
definite movement in through the air for Dawlat, though nothing extreme yet. This ball nips in and strikes the inside half of Chigumbura's defensive poke, rolling to fine leg.
nicely full, and snaking in dangerously towards the stumps. Raza digs it out to mid on.
a little too straight, and the movement takes it further down leg, Raza glancing to fine leg.
punched out through cover point to the sweeper at the boundary.
Raza comes down the track and drives to cover, who gets a palm to it, but not enough to stop the run.

Chigumbura clears his front leg and hammers a drive to wide long off, but the fielder cuts it off. Remember, Afghanistan were able to change the field because the batsmen crossed on the no ball,so there was a man on the boundary.
Raza gets down on one knee to paddle a quick ball from Hamza up and over the keeper.
another quick, flat ball, this time on off stump. Chigumbura backs away to cut into the deep.
punched down to long off.
the singles are coming with ease, Chigumbura forcing to cover off the back foot again.
Raza uses his bottom hand to fetch a full ball into the leg side, another single.
another very quick ball, virtually medium pace, and it's hacked out to the cover sweeper.
powered down the ground, long on cleans up.
Raza gets up on his toes to cut past point, not middled but hit well enough for a single.
and now it's Chigumbura on the cut, collecting another single into the deep.
Dawlat aims for the yorker, but it's not quite full enough and Raza presents the full bat face to find a single to long on.
crunched down the ground once more.
full outside off. Raza waits on it, and then tries to angle the ball behind square, but can't beat point.
Chigumbura immediately walks down the wicket, and places a slower ball through cover point to bring up Zimbabwe's 200.
Raza flashes a drive out square, and as point misfields they're able to turn a dot ball into two runs.
Raza is forward again to drive, and this time the shot goes straight out to the cover sweeper.
flung down the leg side, and called wide.
on a length, just outside off, and Chigumbura stands at the crease to force a single to long off.
chopped to point, who stops it cleanly this time.
slashed square off the front foot, and they put the point fielder under pressure with a quick single. He stops it, but not cleanly.
Raza is cramped for room by one that swings in towards middle and off, nudging the ball back down the track.
up and over extra cover! This is the length Raza has been waiting for, and he leans forward into a majestic, lofted drive. Inside out, and over the infield.
punched to mid off, who is up now, but it's just wide enough of him to allow a scampered single.
Chigumbura swings hard at a length delivery, and the ball flies off the edge and quite fine down to third man. He's one hit away from fifty now.
crunched through cover point. Firmly hit, but there's cover on the boundary.
a full toss on middle is flapped out into the deep with a wristy flick, just the single
Raza comes forward to drive, and the cover sweeper keeps them to one.
in the air ... And safe! Mid off is up inside the circle now, with Afghanistan looking to save runs. Chigumbura wanted to smite this length delivery to wide long off, but it hit the bat really high.
another full toss, and it's flicked to deep square leg.
play and a miss! Chigumbura swings mightily at a full ball outside off, but he can't connect.
a toe-ended drive flies down to third man. Just the one.
that will help Zimbabwe! Aftab hurls one down the leg side, and is called for a wide.
tip and run single! Raza drove the ball hard, and straight at cover. The batsmen charged through for the single, trusting that the fielder couldn't hit the stumps. And, indeed, he could not.
dot ball! Dawlat spears in a reverse swinging yorker, and Raza can only dig it out to cover.
single to third man, off the bottom edge. Again Dawlat was on target with the yorker, but the ball went to the man on the boundary.
another Bulls-eye yorker! Chigumbura swings at it, and the inside edge flies past the stumps and down to fine leg.
No worries at all from Raza. With all the fielders up inside the circle, he picked up a length delivery and mowed it straight back down the ground. An emphatic full stop to the match!
